<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CURRENCY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/28/dollar-sinking?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Another Day, a Sliding Dollar
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Weak dollar" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xOTEzL3dlYWtfZG9sbGFyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The value of the U.S. dollar is <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-dollar-analysis/king-dollars-decline-ripples-across-the-globe-idUSKCN24T1G5?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">diminishing</a> like it’s a degree in travel agentology. The greenback is…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Down 9% from its March highs </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Down about 3% year to date </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>On track for its worst month since 2011  </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why? </strong>Generally speaking, the value of the dollar reflects the U.S.’ overall economic strength relative to other countries. Fluctuations can be caused by anything from geopolitical tensions to market sentiment to unemployment levels. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Can we get wonky on you for a sec? </strong>The <a href="https://seekingalpha.com/article/4361350-end-to-u-s-dollar-hegemony-arrived?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">two main factors</a> for the dollar’s value are the money supply (what it sounds like) and real-yields (the value of bond yields minus inflation). The first is off the charts thanks to Fed Chair Jerome Powell’s print-a-palooza. And the second is in the basement, which has dragged the dollar down.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What a weak dollar means </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For the stock market…<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/chart-with-upwards-trend_1f4c8.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""></strong>. A weaker dollar makes U.S. exports more competitive overseas, plus it minimizes the cost of converting profits made in other currencies. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A Goldman Sachs report showed a median 2.6% bounce in the S&P in months when the dollar dips.  </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For safe haven assets…<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/party-popper_1f389.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""></strong>. The dollar’s decline is a boost for gold, which has shot up to record highs this week. Gold is priced in dollars, which means it’s more attractive to foreign buyers when the dollar is down. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For emerging economies…<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/money-with-wings_1f4b8.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""></strong>. Developing countries’ stocks and some of their currencies have been on a rebound. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Looking ahead…</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Those hoping the dollar will turn around should tune in to the Fed’s policy statement following its meeting today. Then next week, we’ve got the monthly jobs report for July. If either of those signal optimism for a recovery, the dollar could see one, too.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/28/antitrust-hearing-set-take-place-wednesday?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
It's Finally Here
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Big Tech under the antitrust spotlight" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xODIzL2JpZ190ZWNoX3VuZGVyX3RoZV9hbnRpdHJ1c3Rfc3BvdGxpZ2h0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’ve <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/23/brews-guide-big-tech-antitrust-hearings?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">prepped</a> you as much as we could. Now, it’s time to sit back and watch. Today, the CEOs of the mightiest tech companies in the land, Facebook, Amazon, Google, and Apple, will appear before the House Judiciary Committee’s antitrust panel (remotely). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In case you want to review each company’s predicament, we can oblige: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/27/antitrust-spotlight-facebooks-social-media-stronghold?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Facebook</a></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/23/googles-antitrust-issues-not-just-search?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Google</a></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/22/antitrust-spotlight-app-store-hurt-developers-overcharge-consumers?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple</a></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/21/antitrust-spotlight-amazon-improperly-abuse-thirdparty-sellers?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Amazon</a></span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, today we’re releasing a piece on the <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/29/antitrust-us-ongoing-relationship-bigness?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fascinating history of antitrust</a> in the U.S., so you can have some context for what you’re about to watch today. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How to watch</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Time: </strong>12 noon ET, 9am PT</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Where: </strong>This <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WBFDQvIrWYM&feature=emb_logo&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">YouTube livestream</a>.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PHARMA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/28/trump-administration-invests-765m-kodak-produce-pharmaceutical-ingredients?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Kodak Goes From 35mm to 35μm
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Vintage Kodak camera" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xOTE0L2tvZGFrX2NhbWVyYS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Pikist</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Trump administration announced it’s giving Eastman Kodak a $765 million loan to <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/07/28/896209016/trump-gives-medical-stockpile-a-kodak-moment-with-new-loan-to-make-drugs?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">manufacture</a> pharmaceutical ingredients at a pair of plants in New York and Minnesota. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Yep...that Kodak. </strong>Once a cutting-edge tech company with 145,000 employees, Kodak struggled after digital cameras usurped its film business. After filing for bankruptcy in 2012, it’s tried to reinvent itself, including a (failed) foray <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/30/technology/kodak-blockchain-bitcoin.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">into cryptocurrency</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now, it’ll shift operations from mixing chemicals for film to mixing chemicals for drugs. The administration thinks it can get Kodak to <a href="https://www.democratandchronicle.com/story/news/2020/07/28/kodak-us-loan-generic-drugs-ingredients-new-jobs-rochester-ny/5524786002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">manufacture</a> a quarter of active ingredients needed in the U.S., creating 350 jobs along the way.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Remember the Defense Production Act (DPA) President Trump <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/24/manufacturers-retailers-convert-facilities-medical-supply-production?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">invoked</a> early in the pandemic to compel companies to make test kits? The Kodak investment is funneling DPA funds through an agency affiliated with the Defense Department. The broader goal is to rebuild depleted medical stockpiles and reduce dependence on foreign manufacturers, particularly in China.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/28/facebook-twitter-take-viral-coronavirus-misinformation-video?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Sorry, Can’t Let You in: Social Media Bounces Misinfo
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Twitter Follows computer" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNjA2L3R3aXR0ZXJfZm9sbG93cy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><em>Francis Scialabba</em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube execs are nearing an all-crow diet. They had a hearty helping yesterday when the three platforms <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/28/facebook-twitter-youtube-pull-false-coronavirus-video-after-it-goes-viral.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">took down</a> a video promoting dangerous and inaccurate information about the coronavirus...but not before it had racked up at least 20 million views. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The details: </strong>The video came from Breitbart, a far-right news site. In it, people in lab coats claim the anti-malaria drug hydroxychloroquine can cure COVID-19 and “you don’t need masks.” A mountain of scientific evidence refutes those claims. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>President Trump retweeted other accounts that posted clips of the video Monday night, before Twitter removed the videos.  </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Twitter placed restrictions on the account of Trump’s eldest son, Donald Trump Jr., for violating its COVID-19 misinformation policies by sharing the video. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Social media companies claim they’re bending over backward to curb misinformation about the virus. But falsehoods keep going viral faster than the platforms can remove them. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRANSPORTATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/28/revel-suspends-nyc-moped-service-following-two-rider-deaths?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Nothing to Revel in Here
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Revel mopeds" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xOTE2L3JldmVsX21vcGVkcy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><div>"<a href="https://www.flickr.com/photos/southbeachcars/49328331077/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Revel Electric Moped Rentals Downtown Mi</a>" (<a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY 2.0</a>) by <a href="https://www.flickr.com/people/southbeachcars/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Phillip Pessar</a>
</div></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Electric moped service Revel is <a href="https://gothamist.com/news/revel-suspends-operations-after-death-second-rider-month?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">temporarily shutting down</a> in NYC to review safety protocols following the death of a rider Tuesday morning. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Just 10 days after </span><span><em>another</em></span><span> rider’s death, the announcement is too little, too late for the company’s critics, who’ve been pushing for stricter safety rules. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Since launching in 2018, Brooklyn-based Revel has expanded to Miami, Austin, Oakland, and D.C. The pandemic gave it a boost as users avoided public transportation, but with more riders…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>...more problems. Revel’s facing at least a dozen lawsuits, including allegations of faulty mopeds. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">New Revel users have to watch a safety video, and bikes are equipped with two helmets (though Revel has no enforcement mechanism). After the death of the first rider, Revel said it would require in-app safety exams and suspend 2,000+ accounts for unsafe behavior.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>E-scooters faced similar criticisms of putting pedestrians/riders in danger, but the real safety issue is motor vehicles. Despite five years of NYC Mayor Bill de Blasio’s “Vision Zero” program (meaning 0 traffic deaths), 221 people died in traffic crashes last year. </p>

</h3>

width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xOTEzL3dlYWtfZG9sbGFyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe value of the U.S. dollar is \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-dollar-analysis/king-dollars-decline-ripples-across-the-globe-idUSKCN24T1G5?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ediminishing\u003c/a\u003e like it’s a degree in travel agentology. The greenback is…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDown 9% from its March highs \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDown about 3% year to date \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOn track for its worst month since 2011  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy? \u003c/strong\u003eGenerally speaking, the value of the dollar reflects the U.S.’ overall economic strength relative to other countries. Fluctuations can be caused by anything from geopolitical tensions to market sentiment to unemployment levels. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCan we get wonky on you for a sec? \u003c/strong\u003eThe \u003ca href=\"https://seekingalpha.com/article/4361350-end-to-u-s-dollar-hegemony-arrived?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etwo main factors\u003c/a\u003e for the dollar’s value are the money supply (what it sounds like) and real-yields (the value of bond yields minus inflation). The first is off the charts thanks to Fed Chair Jerome Powell’s print-a-palooza. And the second is in the basement, which has dragged the dollar down.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat a weak dollar means \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFor the stock market…\u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/chart-with-upwards-trend_1f4c8.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e. A weaker dollar makes U.S. exports more competitive overseas, plus it minimizes the cost of converting profits made in other currencies. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA Goldman Sachs report showed a median 2.6% bounce in the S\u0026P in months when the dollar dips.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFor safe haven assets…\u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/party-popper_1f389.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e. The dollar’s decline is a boost for gold, which has shot up to record highs this week. Gold is priced in dollars, which means it’s more attractive to foreign buyers when the dollar is down. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFor emerging economies…\u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/money-with-wings_1f4b8.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e. Developing countries’ stocks and some of their currencies have been on a rebound. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThose hoping the dollar will turn around should tune in to the Fed’s policy statement following its meeting today. Then next week, we’ve got the monthly jobs report for July. If either of those signal optimism for a recovery, the dollar could see one, too.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the Trump administration announced it’s giving Eastman Kodak a $765 million loan to \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/07/28/896209016/trump-gives-medical-stockpile-a-kodak-moment-with-new-loan-to-make-drugs?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" Minnesota. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eYep...that Kodak. \u003c/strong\u003eOnce a cutting-edge tech company with 145,000 employees, Kodak struggled after digital cameras usurped its film business. After filing for bankruptcy in 2012, it’s tried to reinvent itself, including a (failed) foray \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/30/technology/kodak-blockchain-bitcoin.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einto cryptocurrency\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow, it’ll shift operations from mixing chemicals for film to mixing chemicals for drugs. The administration thinks it can get Kodak to \u003ca href=\"https://www.democratandchronicle.com/story/news/2020/07/28/kodak-us-loan-generic-drugs-ingredients-new-jobs-rochester-ny/5524786002/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emanufacture\u003c/a\u003e a quarter of active ingredients needed in the U.S., creating 350 jobs along the way.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eRemember the Defense Production Act (DPA) President Trump \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/24/manufacturers-retailers-convert-facilities-medical-supply-production?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einvoked\u003c/a\u003e early in the pandemic to compel companies to make test kits? The Kodak investment is funneling DPA funds through an agency affiliated with the Defense Department. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFacebook, Twitter, and YouTube execs are nearing an all-crow diet. They had a hearty helping yesterday when the three platforms \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/28/facebook-twitter-youtube-pull-false-coronavirus-video-after-it-goes-viral.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etook down\u003c/a\u003e a video promoting dangerous and inaccurate information about the coronavirus...but not before it had racked up at least 20 million views. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe details: \u003c/strong\u003eThe video came from Breitbart, a far-right news site. In it, people in lab coats claim the anti-malaria drug hydroxychloroquine can cure COVID-19 and “you don’t need masks.” A mountain of scientific evidence refutes those claims. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePresident Trump retweeted other accounts that posted clips of the video Monday night, before Twitter removed the videos.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTwitter placed restrictions on the account of Trump’s eldest son, Donald Trump Jr., for violating its COVID-19 misinformation policies by sharing the video. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eSocial media companies claim they’re bending over backward to curb misinformation about the virus.
